thread.title: UAB Gurney Derby highlights Homecoming Week
thread.title_full: UAB Gurney Derby highlights Homecoming Week | AL.com

author: Joe Songer | jsonger@al.com
title: UAB Gurney Derby highlights Homecoming Week
text:
It's UAB Homecoming Week and time for the annual Gurney Derby. Twenty teams participated in the longest running homecoming event at UAB.
The Gurney Derby is one of the most popular UAB Homecoming Week traditions. Teams of four, two men and two women, race down and back on a stretch of 13th Street South while pushing a "passenger" on old hospital gurneys.
Monkeys, a knight in a suit of armor and several stuffed animals got to ride on the gurneys this year.
This year, the Gurney Derby was blessed with perfect weather and the event drew a nice crowd. First place went to the School of Education. Their team made the circuit in a snappy 28.20 seconds.
The theme of Homecoming 2015 is "Blazer Strong â€“ Go UAB. Go Blazers. Go Birmingham."
